text: here's how much debts the Greek
government owes and here's how much has
been wiped off the Chinese stock market
in less than a month 10 times the entire
GDP of Greece
it's an event the BBC's economics editor
Robert Peston is calling a financial
earthquake so why did it happen
the Chinese stock market has boomed in
the past year with one major index
increasing in value by over a hundred
and fifty percent investors borrowed
huge amounts to buy the shares but then
had to sell their shares to repay their
debts but surely stocks and shares
fluctuate like this all the time they do
but this crash is hitting millions of
small investors often working-class
families who have spent their savings on
stocks the Chinese government is trying
to stop the freefall by restricting the
sale of shares so far the restrictions
have calmed markets somewhat but many
millions of Chinese are still counting
their losses
